messages.subject: Re: Beaches, was Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] myers-briggs
messages.msgSnippet: ... Here on the wet coast there are only a few protected or very shallow beaches that are warm enough for swimming, even in August.  Most of them are on the
messages.messageBody:
>
> Well, here there is a brief period in the middle/end of August when you
> might actually enjoy being in the water. I like it cold, in fact, and I am
> not overly fond of swimming in the warm lake we live beside.

Here on the "wet coast" there are only a few protected or very shallow
beaches that are warm enough for swimming, even in August. Most of them are
on the east coast of Vancouver Island.
Tia
>
> Do you know the summer call of the Northerner? "Come on in, it's great
once
> you get used to it."

Gee, we used to say that in the high sierra glacier-fed lakes.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Beaches, was Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] myers-briggs
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, here there is a brief period in the middle/end of August when you might actually enjoy being in the water. I like it cold, in fact, and I am not
messages.messageBody:
At 08:55 AM 6/12/03 -0700, you wrote:

> > > Where? Please say Pacific NorthWest US. Or Canada.
> >
> > But why would we want to be beach bums way up THERE!! :)
>
>Yeah, it's not like we can actually *swim* in the ocean without a wetsuit up
>here. <g>
>Tia

Well, here there is a brief period in the middle/end of August when you
might actually enjoy being in the water. I like it cold, in fact, and I am
not overly fond of swimming in the warm lake we live beside.

Do you know the summer call of the Northerner? "Come on in, it's great once
you get used to it."

Donna Andrea in Nova Scotia
